name: Subbuteo
description:
Subbuteo recreates the famous table football game, which makes for something very different from Sensible/Kick Off/FIFA style games. It's effectively a turn-based strategy game of sorts, as each player has 30 seconds to make their move (within a 30 minute match length), which involves first selecting a player, then aiming the direction in which he will be flicked, then the power and swerve of the flick are determined by the length of time the button is held down for.

With any luck, your player will hit the ball, and hit it such that it doesn't leave the playing area, and doesn't hit an opponent. If any of those rules are violated, possession passes to the opposition. Before each flick, the team not in possession can make a 'defensive flick' involving moving one of their players into a potential blocking position (without hitting the ball or an opponent, as this is a foul).
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS | Combined View

shot.caption: This screen displays as the game loads
The first choice the player must make is the type of game.
A league game has been selected. There is no existing league to load so a new one is set up. First question is how many players are there. There's just me so I reply 1
The game briefly displays a picture of a match in progress, not from the game, before over-writing it with a league table. Here only the players name has been altered.
All leagues have fixtures. These are the first round matches
The TIME option on the fixtures screen allows the match duration to be altered. Default is 15 minutes. I reset to 5
Team MOBY plays in match 1
Before play can start the player must select a controller
This looks like a good sign, team MOBY wins the toss ....
.... and will be playing an attacking formation
... the computer does the same.
The player is selected by scrolling through the team with the Z / X keys. The currently selected player's symbol flashes. Selection can be aborted & restarted
The ball is on the centre spot. The central red player is selected. The small white spot to the right is the direction he's facing.
The player is turned to face the ball with the Z / X  keys, then SPACE is used to make the shot.
The bar indicates two things, the amount of spin on the flick, and the power of the flick
The blue team are attacking. Moby gets the chance to defend by flicking a player into a strategic position.
After an illegal move players can optionally be repositioned
Nil - Nil at half time.
A players move must be completed in 30 seconds....
... or else an indirect free kick is awarded
End of the match. The game pauses here until ENTER is pressed
Naturally the result is displayed. I regard this as a moral victory
Then the next match in the league is played ....
... which is between two computer teams and can be watched. A good way to pick up tips on game play & tactics.
